content: Cover art added, neglected to comment.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very nice puzzle which is clearly not an easy one ! And sure not the easiest one of the medium puzzles... I found the statement clear and easy to understand, and the tests and validators are well done.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I liked solving this puzzle, harder than it first looks, definitely a medium puzzle.
Test cases seems to cover everything & statement is clear.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: As a child, we used to giggle as we tried to recite "tongue twisters". For me, this puzzle was a tongue twister. It seemed as if I would never get my team teamings teamed up just right!

I loved your puzzle. Your write-up is very well done. The test cases are clever. The material is plenty challenging, but I think it works in the "easy" category. I like to see the Codingamer looking for an easy puzzle still challenged with material such as this. Overall, great job!

Goal section
* Should it be "MRZ" instead of "MRF"?

Output section
* Please define O.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.
I think the statement needs to be clarified a bit, and I need to add bigger test cases (and some edge cases too) but I'll get back to that later...
Thanks for the feedback! These issues should be fixed now

Thanks! I'm debating bumping the difficulty up to medium, since it's not entirely straight-forward (especially if using a language without built-in combinations function). I find it hard to judge the difficulty of my own problems but I feel like it's definitely on the harder side of easy.
I agree with everybody else on the medium classification. It never did feel quite right when I was trying to support the original easy classification. I should have trusted my gut!
